title: Dr Kedir Ahmed
text:
About me
I am an epidemiologist and health data scientist with a clinical background and a PhD from Western Sydney University, Australia. My core expertise lies in designing epidemiological studies, analysing complex datasets, and interpreting results using advanced statistical and machine learning methods to generate actionable insights from health data. My research focuses on understanding of how modifiable risk factors influence population health, particularly in the context of chronic diseases such as cardiovascular disease, type 2 diabetes, and obesity. I am especially interested in uncovering causal dietary and lifestyle risk factors using modern analytical approaches that combine traditional epidemiology with causal inference, machine learning, and spatial analysis.

title: Dr Kedir Ahmed
text:
Education
Doctor of Philosophy, Western Sydney University, Australia, 2018-2023
Masters in Health Data Science, University of New South Wales, Australia, 2024-2026
Masters of Public Health, University of Gondar, Ethiopia, 2011-2013
Bachelors in Public Health, Arba Minch University, Ethiopia, 2007-2010

title: Dr Kedir Ahmed
text: I am an epidemiologist and health data scientist with a clinical background and a PhD from Western Sydney University, Australia. My core expertise lies in designing epidemiological studies, analysing complex datasets, and interpreting results using advanced statistical and machine learning methods to generate actionable insights from health data. My research focuses on deepening our understanding of how modifiable risk factors influence population health, particularly in the context of chronic diseases such as cardiovascular disease, type 2 diabetes, and obesity. I am especially interested in uncovering causal dietary and lifestyle risk factors using modern analytical approaches that combine traditional epidemiology with causal inference, machine learning, and spatial analysis.
